attributes.action: Ban insurance companies from charging administration fees
attributes.background: Insurance companies are charging administration fees for starting/cancelling/amending policies when this work is all automated by the systems they have in place and the price charged is disproportional to the work involved.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies do not incur any extra printing or postage charges to make amendments to policies anymore as everything is online, any changes made are processed automatically through the system, the charges were first introduced to cover the cost of the paper and ink and postage for sending letters.

attributes.action: Give all farmed animals access to fresh air and daylight.
attributes.background: Farmed animals can be kept in near darkness with no access to fresh air or natural light spending their whole lives in sheds that are little more than dungeons. The denial of natural light and fresh intensifies great suffering to intelligent and sentient life forms.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence of such practices and concomitant suffering is plentiful. I use these examples but there are many. This YouTube film is about the abuses of factory farmed animals but the birds and pigs can clearly be seen to have little or no access to daylight or fresh air - increasing the risks to animal and human health.

https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/press-releases/2017/07/new-interactive-map-exposes-uk-factory-farming-hotspots

https://youtu.be/IVGR1N2Pl00

attributes.action: After Brexit - Expats spouses should be allowed to live in the UK without a visa
attributes.background: After the Brexit, British expats should be able to bring our partners/wifes/husbands who are not British to live in the UK without a visa (as in the past being in Europe).
attributes.additional_details: With the current deal for Brexit, if you want to move back, we can get passports for our children but not our wifes or husbands. Our wifes and husbands should be given freedom of movement as our children do. We are families, we shouldn’t be split apart.

attributes.action: Scrap interest on student loans
attributes.background: The threshold for repayment has been increased from £21000 to £25000, but this goes no way towards dealing with the issue of high interest on student loans. Those who leave university with £50000 of debt could potentially be liable for £100k+ repayment over the lifetime of the loan. This is wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Those earning over £45k have to pay top interest rates of 6.3 percent and this can accrue for 30 years. Higher than most mortgages, yet students are expected to still go ahead and get on the property ladder in an already challenging market. Moreover, many graduates in London who are exposed to a higher cost of living (and salary to compensate) will be exposed to the higher interest rate just because of their location.

www.slc.co.uk/students-and-customers/loan-repayment/interest-rates.aspx

attributes.action: Ban smoking in the Royal Parks
attributes.background: The Royal Parks serve as the 'lungs' of London - a green refuge where Londoners can go to find fresh air in a city with some of the worst air quality in the UK.  As such, this precious space should be kept smoke-free so that people don't have to dodge second hand smoke as they exercise/relax.
attributes.additional_details:
London poor air quality:  
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-38735896
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/jan/30/london-reaches-legal-air-pollution-limit-just-one-month-into-the-new-year

Dangers of second-hand smoke:
https://www.nhsinform.scot/healthy-living/stopping-smoking/reasons-to-stop/second-hand-smoke

attributes.action: Deploy carbon capture and storage technology at scale across the UK by 2021.
attributes.background: Runaway climate change will happen unless we dramatically cut emissions within a decade. Carbon capture (CCUS) technology removes up to 90% of CO2 from air, but the UK government intends to deploy it at scale only in the 2030s. We demand that the government rolls out CCUS nationwide by 2021.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose that the government:
-	brings forward nationwide CCUS deployment to 2021;
-	provides more funding for CCUS optimisation and supports emissions-cutting CCUS plants regardless of profit;
-	oversees global transfers of CCUS technology and compels overseas states to deploy CCUS.

UN: http://www.ipcc.ch/report/sr15/
CCUS: https://www.worldcoal.org/reducing-co2-emissions/carbon-capture-use-storage 
Gov: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/uk-carbon-capture-and-storage-government-funding-and-support

attributes.action: Give equal child related financial support to all families,not just "low income"
attributes.background: "Low income"families receive an abundance of financial help when they have a child.Tax credits/Maternity grants/benefits/free nursey places etc.With such low maternity pay slashing working household income I believe that all families with young children should receive the same financial help.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the support available for "low income" families.

Maternity grants
Child tax credits
Healthy start scheme
Housing benefit
Free nursery from a younger age than those who are not low income.
Council tax reduction
Etc etc

If you fall above the threshold and receive no help, you can end up worse off than those "low income families" and working harder for it too.

All babies/children deserve the same start/support from our government. We pay into the system, so support us when we need it.

attributes.action: Make chain stores responsible for their plastic packaging, i.e extreme fines
attributes.background:
In every shop you visit how many items are packaged in plastic? 

We need to make chain companies responsible for their plastic input to our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
If the Goverment fines: 
• Super Stores/Markets
• Retail Stores
• Warehouses
• Fast food chains
• Delivery companies 
• etc
For the amount of plastic packaging and waste they produce, the UK should see a decline in plastic packaging; in turn this could lessen the companies fines. With the money that it produces this could go towards companies who break down plastics to recycle them, or in to making any plastic waste in to materials to make roads, for example, instead of using asphalt.

attributes.action: Pay all employed Carers the Living Wage
attributes.background: Caring, in our life time we will all require a need for caring, either for ourselves or for a person close to us. Carers need to work on Person-Centred Care principals via the Care Support Plan.
attributes.additional_details:
Their responsibilities are intimate personal care, washing, dressing, meal preparation, Financial management, Emotional support, Safeguarding, Daily planning, Social inclusion, Wellbeing, respect and dignity in a personalised, dignified manner, respect for property and items within that property. National Living Wage is £7.83 and the Living Wage is £9.00. Pay rates need to reflect the responsibilities, pay Carers the Living Wage.

The Care Industry is hanging by a thread. In 2015, Carers UK found that Family Carers save the UK economy £132 billion a year and that if even a small proportion of Family Carers were unable to carry on caring, the economic effect would be “catastrophic”. We need to attract more people to the caring professional by paying the Living Wage.

attributes.action: Require payslips to state the holiday gained and remaining
attributes.background: It has been said in the Guardian that UK agency workers lose out on £500m a year in missing holiday pay, but this amount is greater, as it does not include the miscalculations on employees working irregular or in zero hour contracts.
attributes.additional_details:
In this link, you will find the guardian explain that staff working for agencies are earning an average of 22p an hour less than employees for exactly the same work.

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/nov/30/uk-agency-workers-lose-out-on-500m-a-year-in-missing-holiday-pay 

The government page offers a way to calculate holiday entitlement but this system is not fair, as main employees and in some occasions, employers, are losing money with it.

https://www.gov.uk/calculate-your-holiday-entitlement

attributes.action: Stop sanctioning benefit claimants by withdrawing access to money.
attributes.background:
No one in the UK should be left without access to benefits. Sanctions  lead to further poverty which can include loss of homes and sometimes to death.
Losing benefits is not a proportionate response to missed appointments. No one should be denied access to money.
It is time for sanctions to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/one-in-five-benefit-related-deaths-involved-sanctions-admits-dwp/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2015/aug/27/death-britains-benefits-system-fit-for-work-safety-net

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/benefits-sanction-resulted-in-my-brother-david-clapson-s-death-says-gill-thompson-as-she-pleads-for-a6911386.html

https://edition.cnn.com/2018/11/05/uk/uk-austerity-un-rapporteur-intl/index.html

attributes.action: Ban Unpaid Internships
attributes.background: Unpaid and voluntary internships of all lengths must be made illegal. They are exploitative & harm social mobility. Despite the Government's recent efforts, they are still common. It must be made easier for interns to understand their rights, and to report organisations that offer unpaid work.
attributes.additional_details:
It has been estimated that an unpaid internship last one month in London will cost the intern over £1000. 

More information and research into unpaid internships can be found on the Sutton Trust for social mobility website: 
https://www.suttontrust.com/about-us/us/social-mobility/

For more information on your rights as an intern, visit:
https://www.gov.uk/employment-rights-for-interns

attributes.action: Introduce conjugal visits in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In many other countries conjugal visits are permitted. However, in the U.K. it is not permitted. the biggest advantages of allowing conjugal visits is prisoners tend to follow the rules for fear of losing their right to have a visit. Moreover, the biggest advantage is families no longer suffer.
attributes.additional_details: Conjugal visits are allowed in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Denmark, Germany, india, Israel, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, and Spain. In the US, conjugal visits are not allowed in Federal prisons, but California, New York, Mississippi, Washington, and Connecticut permit them.

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit on the motorways/dual carrigeways to 85mph!
attributes.background: 1967 was the year when the 70mph speed limit was set, since then cars, roads and driving moral improved a lot. Today 90% of the cars on the roads been made after 2005, these cars are all equipped with all the safety features to safely travel on higer speed.
attributes.additional_details:
Higher speed limit must come with mandatory minimum that should be 60mph!

Belgium, France, Holland, Germany all has a higher speed limit than Uk to improve the traffic flow on their motorways, in my personal opinion this could be a solution for England aswell.

Austria just started to test a new 87mph speed limit on a 30miles section, if that works well they will raise the limit on all of their motorways.

attributes.action: Make supermarkets STOP using plastic and start using more sustainable packaging
attributes.background: We have “12 years to limit climate change catastrophe” (IPPC) I cannot help but look around at these huge corporations that are constantly using up energy and plastic (creating what I can only imagine are vast amounts of waste) If we want to keep the world turning let’s DO something about it!!
attributes.additional_details: I know it’s not a quick fix issue but I think, even if just one corporation changed, a huge difference would be made. This discussion needs to continue and has to evolve into actions if the situation is going to get any better. People need to be educated into the importance of recycling and how it is to be carried out because, I know it’s hard to believe, but some people have no idea what can and can’t be recycled! Please help change occur and sign this petition to start conversations and action

attributes.action: Leave the EU with no deal, free trade with the commonwealth
attributes.background: The British people voted to leave the EU not stay in the EU in every practical sense. Morals come above money, if our economy is slightly hurt it is worth the price of self rule, freedom and pride. We should build strong trade bonds with the common wealth but no free movement of people.

attributes.action: Change rights for parents that have nothing to do with their children
attributes.background: My daughter’s father has been out of her life since she was 7 months old. I need his consent for me to change her name or to take her out the country.
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken with a lawyer who explained to me that I would need to find him and tell him about the name change and if he does not agree then we go to court, but we have no contact whatsoever. The same was told to me about taking her out of the country. I’m hoping to get something in place where if the dad/Mum is out of their life for 2 or more years then they lose their rights over these things.

attributes.action: Make all products state on the label whether they have used animal testing
attributes.background: Many people are against animal testing or want to reduce the number of products they buy that use it but there isn't enough information in store about the companies that use animal testing so people are generally unaware about the extent of it. This addition would allow a more informed choice.
attributes.additional_details: Due to medical progress now, many agree that animal testing should only be used when completely necessary yet the U.K. are still estimated to be in the top 9 testers in the world. People should be more aware of what's go in to the product in front of them, right there in the shop without having to search online. At total of 3.79 million experiments were conducted by the U.K. In 2017

attributes.action: Introduce carbon tax in the UK.
attributes.background: The UN recently reported that we have 12 years to reduce carbon emission by 45% or we will face a climate change catastrophe. According to a study published by the Guardian it is reported that just 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global emissions. We need to take action!
attributes.additional_details:
By introducing a carbon tax it will encourage companies emitting large amounts of carbon dioxide will lower their carbon footprint or companies will turn to renewable energy.  This is real and cannot be avoided, going vegan, having a shower instead of a bath, cycling all help but companies emitting large amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere need to dealt with.
Watch this video here for more information - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CilVymuAM8A

attributes.action: Support Parents with Learning Disabilities & Mental Health
attributes.background: Too many parents with complex needs aren’t being supported to parent. Rather than being given a chance with the right support they, have their children removed. It's plain wrong and unfair on the child as well as the parent & needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: A service should be created within social services to support parents with learning disabilities and mental health issues to parent and prevent children being taken into care and forced adoptions taking place.

attributes.action: Force all new build house purchases to have a retainer on purchase agreements.
attributes.background: More new build houses are being built each day. Problems with new builds are soaring and NHBC warranties is not enough to protect buyers. Developers should be force to accept retainer agreements from purchasers to protect them against nightmare builds, retaining part of funds until work is completed
attributes.additional_details: I am a new build homeowner. 8 months in to date. We have suffered unimaginable losses financially and also mentally due to a nightmare build. We have had drains incorrectly installed, we have a house that does not have building control sign off and we are still no where near getting our house right. I live on a street where 10 other residents also have houses that are not signed off from building control, yet we are living in these houses. The system is very very broken and people are suffering.

attributes.action: Investigate Northerns poor running of Northern Rail and revoke their franchise.
attributes.background: Northern Rail have proven they are not fit to run a rail franchise. Between issues with cancellations and delays. Poorly maintained rolling stock, over charging for tickets, the fiasco of their time table change and more recently their inability to handle strikes in a way that will resolve them.
attributes.additional_details: Northern need to be actively and impartially investigated by an external body. If they are found to be as lacking as they appear their franchise should be forcefully revoked and put up for tender to companies who are vaguely competent.

attributes.action: Conduct an inquiry into the dispute between TOC's and the RMT.
attributes.background: This Petition Calls upon the relevant Secretary of State to exercise his powers under section 215 of the ‘Trade Union and Labour Relations (Consolidation) Act 1992’ to either conduct an inquiry or to appoint a court of inquiry into the running dispute between Train Operating Companies and the RMT!

attributes.action: Include all delivery services within the regulatory control of Ofcom
attributes.background: As a largely unregulated industry (other than Royal Mail), the services of delivery companies (Yodel, Hermes etc.) seem to be getting worse. I call on the Government to include all delivery services within the regulatory control of Ofcom to ensure standards are met for both consumers and employees.
attributes.additional_details:
2.8 billion packages and parcels were delivered in 2016, a rise of 65% in four years, up from 1.7 billion in 2012. This represents a delivery market in the region of £10.1 billion in 2016. This is expected to grow in 2021 to around £13.2 billion.

Reading reviews of these delivery companies and the services they provide do not, however, make good reading. Deluges of parcels being lost or damaged, passing the buck back to sellers, excluding pretty much every item with a resale value from loss and poor delivery practices coming from pressures on delivery drivers and poor pay.

With even more retailers growing their online sales, this market is due to grow further with no signs of abating. The services being provided need to be properly regulated and companies held to account more easily.

attributes.action: CEO total income capped to no more than 60 times the lowest employee income.
attributes.background:
FTSE 100 CEOs are now paid:

•    165 times more than a nurse.

•    140 times more than a teacher.

•    132 times more than a police officer.

I want CEO pay capped to a 60 times ratio of the lowest paid in the company. If they want a pay rise everyone should get one.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.equalitytrust.org.uk/taxonomy/term/136

attributes.action: Make calls to the Police non-emergency number 101 free.
attributes.background: Calls to 999 are free, but often these are not urgent. Calls to the NHS 111 are free. The public are encouraged (quite rightly) to report crimes, but are discouraged by the cost. If the Police want the public to report more crimes, and to reduce non-urgent 999 calls, 101 should be a free service.

attributes.action: Remove all right to buy legislation (including voluntary RTB) from all  Statutes
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that Social Housing has been and continues to be, damaged by Right to Buy legislation. We believe that this legislation must be removed from Statutory legislation.
attributes.additional_details: Research has shown that a high percentage of Social Housing sold under Right to Buy legislation has created a sub market for private landlords which has forced up the cost of welfare rental payments to the detriment of all tax payers.

attributes.action: Adopt the recommendations of the UN Special Rapporteur on extreme poverty
attributes.background:
Britain is the 5th largest economy in the world and it houses one of the world's key global economic centres.
Despite this, the UN say ⅕th of the population are in poverty, and 1.5 million are destitute.
The government must immediately adopt recommendations made, and rectify the immense harm done.
attributes.additional_details:
The conclusion of the report states that permissiveness of poverty in the UK, especially since 2010, has been a choice. Austerity was opted for with knowledge or ignorance of the fact it would disproportionately affect working class communities, women, disabled and chronically ill people, children and BAME people.

The conclusion lays out simple solutions, such as improving public services, social inclusion and reviewing Universal Credit.

We demand the Government adopt these recommendations.

attributes.action: Include DBS check as a part of aplication for "settled status" after Brexit
attributes.background: This petition calls for adding a Criminal Record  check to the application for "settled status" for citizens of EEA  after Brexit. All European migrants should have clean DBS check to receive opportunity to settle down in United Kingdom after Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has voted to leave the EU and this is one time opportunity to rid out those who not obey the law of United Kingdom. This could reduce crime rates, save thousands of pounds in insurance cost and trauma for victims at no cost to taxpayer. Those who fail to deliver clear DBS should be refused right to settle down in United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Make guide dogs available as part of the mobility scheme, not reliant on charity
attributes.background: There is nothing more curtailing of your independence and mobility than sight loss, funds should be available via the mobility scheme to train a guide dog rather than people being reliant on charitable funds.

attributes.action: Allow pupils to opt out of music lessons on religious grounds
attributes.background: Some muslims believe Islam forbids them to play musical instruments, listen to music, dance and can not play a role in it. As this subject is compulsory on the National Curriculum, some muslims are being forced to go against their religion by schools.
attributes.additional_details:
As parents we have full right over what information is delivered to our children. Muslims should not have to compromise with anyone on what they believe to be clear cut orders and principles conveyed in their religion. So therefore the subject music should be optional. Evidence from the Holy Book (Quran), Allah SWT, says in Surah Luqman, "And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech [music] to mislead [others] from the way of Allah will have a humiliating
punishment". [Luqman 31:6]

attributes.action: State categorically that Canada has our support in its spat with Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: At a time when Britain is leaving the EU and restrengthening our links with our Commonwealth friends, why have we turned our back on Canada during their assault by Saudi Arabia? We share a monarchy and history, so an attack on Canada is also an attack on us and our way of life.
attributes.additional_details: We should back Canada fully against Saudi Arabia and show them that they are not alone in standing up for human rights in the world. Cowardice and arms sales should never come before long term friends and relations. Many of us have family members in Canada and our history goes back all the way. How embarrassing that our government has put money before pride, morality and friends.

attributes.action: Legalise bow hunting in the UK
attributes.background:
I am petitioning as a fellow bowman to relegalise bow hunting. It has been a skillful way of supplying meat since the ancient times.

But now, in the UK, it is all done by guns, and bows are no longer legal. There is neither any explanation as to why it is illegalised. But we can change that.
attributes.additional_details:
The difference between guns and bows are as follows;
Bullets can get lost in your game, only to be found painfully when eating the game - Arrows get taken out soon after game is caught.
Guns are loud, scaring the animal before it dies - Bows are not as loud, if without silencers, still allowing a more humane hunt.
Gun fumes and bullet/shell remains are pollutable - Arrows are collected if found.
Bows are lighter but more convenient to that of loading a gun, which emmits noise.

attributes.action: Ask the Paralympic Committee to move the swimming Championships from Malaysia.
attributes.background: The Malaysian prime minister has publicly stated about how Jews have “hooked noses,” and other anti-Semitic sentiments, states there is “no place for Israeli athletes in Malaysia” following Malaysia’s refusal to grant visas to Israeli athletes in the World Paralympic Swimming Championship.
attributes.additional_details: Sport is a source of uniting people together though different backgrounds regardless of politics, sex, race, religion, and more. To disallow Israeli athletes to perform in the championships is not only an insult to what the Olympics stand for, but also a slap in the face to the benefits Israel has provided to aid paraplegics continue to prosper in their lives by creating products like the ReWalk exoskeleton used during the London Marathon.

attributes.action: Applications for ILR - Standard service failure should be illegal
attributes.background: Families are facing emotional distress from Home Office delays to process applications with some taking up to 2 years when their standard service is up to 6 months. During this time applicants are restricted on what to do since the passports are kept by HO and there’s no resident residence status.
attributes.additional_details:
The law should be changed so the Home Office can face legal sanctions if they fail to meet their standard service targets.
 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-england-41096675
 
https://www.ein.org.uk/news/independent-increasing-home-office-delays-deciding-settlement-visas-despite-falling

attributes.action: Sex crimes against children to receive harsher penalties and mandatory jail time
attributes.background: Paedophiles who arrange to meet children, help facilitate attacks over the internet, download child pornography or sexually abuse children are often getting very little if at all any jail time; this is not a deterrent to those who seek out our children for their own twisted needs.
attributes.additional_details:
More details
It's about time paedophiles are scared of the sentences given at court to deter them from their crimes. No crime is victimless; children are abused so others can download the pictures therefore facilitating this crime. Parents and non parents are outraged when a shoplifter can get a heavier sentence than those who destroy the souls of our children and it's about time that stopped

attributes.action: In an effort to reduce plastic wastage, ban the use of multi-pack plastic film.
attributes.background: The aim of this petition is to reduce the use of single-use plastic, and the litter associated with it. Any steps taken to stop the flow of plastics to our oceans are to be welcomed - this extra packaging is unnecessary and is posing a threat to marine life.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/food/2018/sep/06/carlsberg-to-replace-plastic-ring-can-holders-with-recyclable-glue

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/single-use-plastic-carrier-bags-why-were-introducing-the-charge/carrier-bags-why-theres-a-5p-charge

attributes.action: Ban non 'diet' fizzy drinks having sweeteners in them
attributes.background:
Since the introduction of the sugar tax companies have been changing recipes for their standard drinks to reduce the amount of sugar by adding sweeteners.
For many people who either do not want to drink a 'diet' drink this has become very confusing and in most cases you cannot buy a drink without.
attributes.additional_details:
An example is the halving of Sugar in Lucozade (a recommended drink for people with diabetes to combat hypoglycaemic events). 
Or drinks labled 'Regular' or 'Classic' now contain sweetener although there are already no added sugar or diet versions.

The sugar tax has reduced a consumers choice so it is near impossible to buy a drink without sweeteners and it is already being shown that they cause as much a health risk as too much sugar. 
Moderation is the way forward not lack of choice.

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable plastics, plastic toys  & plastic bags in the UK.
attributes.background:
According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics.
More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050.”
attributes.additional_details:
As a mother of 2 young children I feel now is the time to #endplasticuse4good.
I travelled to Kenya recently and I was surprised to discover that they have banned the use of plactic bags and so on.
We MUST all take action now to save our planet. Please support this petition!
The toy companies must be accountable and be charged for making plastic toys that are easily disposable!

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the press to name people arrested until they've been charged
attributes.background:
As recent events have proven, often the press will name people arrested and snoop into their private lives as well as quiz friends, family and neighbours. There can be no benefit to this especially in high profile cases with global attention. 
 
Require anonymity until a charge has been brought.

attributes.action: Law change. No reduced sentence if plea changed after further evidence heard.
attributes.background: For victims reliving evidence can be very traumatic and then seeing the offender getting a reduced sentence is adding more pain. For example, abused children may see the sex offender get shorter sentences as they have pleaded guilty when the child discloses more information about the offence.
attributes.additional_details: There should be no reduction in sentence for a guilty plea made after the victim has given evidence.

attributes.action: I would like it to be made compulsory for a child to have a DNA test at birth.
attributes.background: I believe that it is the number 1 human right to know who you are. Technology makes this possible it needs to be compulsory so people don’t find out in adulthood that their biological father isn’t who they thought it was.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the government to step in and make it compulsory for a child to have a DNA test at birth and give the child the knowledge of who their fathers are and vice versa
 
The DNA sample should be destroyed and other further information should be taken. The result should be entered on a child's birth certificate.
 
I am a mother and I believe children and men need to know who they are related too. It will takes away doubt and makes for a more confident, honest society, for children to grow up in.

attributes.action: New powers to take over failing schools
attributes.background: Government and local authorities need powers to take over failing schools. After the notification in March this year to close Plymouth Studio School, it was acknowledged that the secondary school system in Plymouth is failing our children. The Government must intervene.
attributes.additional_details: Six months on and into a new school year, the children from Studio School have been forgotten and the standards of our Plymouth Secondary Schools are well below the national average. Exam results are well below what they should be and although MPs have spoken out, I can see no action or improvements. The promises made to the Studio School children haven’t been upheld and they have been swept under the carpet. The current system is failing our children. The Government must accept responsibility.

attributes.action: Make emotional abuse and bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Unless there has been a threat of violence, nothing can be done to stop emotional abuse. This seriously affects mental health. This is a major problem for ex-partners and their children. Emotional abuse should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: It is also not possible for someone to leave their job for bullying and to go onto job seeker's allowance despite this affecting their mental health due to this not currently being seen as an issue.

attributes.action: Make carers allowance payable to carers after they reach pensionable age.
attributes.background: I have cared for my husband for the last 18+years after he sustained a traumatic brain injury. I had to give up my full time job to do this and now I find that I am going to loose CA  when I  reach pensionable age which I feel is grossly unfair as I am still a full time carer.

attributes.action: Re-instate legal aid in all childrens' cases
attributes.background: Currently the law with regards to legal aid and childrens cases only comes into effect if the case is in a public interest, private cases are not covered under legal aid and because of this those who can not afford a solicitor are being forced to prove they are exempt from paying court costs.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that legal aid is made available on all cases regarding child law so that no person fighting for custody or access under private law is penalized or forced into debt by having to fund court cases over their child, every parent has a right and legal aid should be available for all not just the privileged few that are able to represent themselves. Without this those on benefits are unable to have assistance from solicitors to help with their case

attributes.action: Reinstate DLA for those with mental health or learning disabilities.
attributes.background: Personal Independence Payments criteria is frightfully ill-suited for those claimants that have a form of learning difficulty or mental health condition. The PIP criteria is dreadfully preposterous for this division of society. We are asking the government to reinstate DLA for these groups.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like the government to reconsider their options in regards to reinstating the Disability Living Allowance Criteria for this group of claimants. The following links back up the point of this petition.
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/dwp-fit-to-work-assessments-cost-more-than-they-save-report-reveals-a6801636.html

attributes.action: Use Belfast for the maintenance of the UK carrier fleet.
attributes.background: The dry dock facilities in Belfast (BDD) are some of the largest in Europe and are under-utilised. They would be ideal for use in the long-term maintenance of the UK's two Aircraft Carriers. Minimal cost modifications would be required for accommodation and workshops.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government must analyse the costs of using Belfast Dry Dock (BDD) rather than Portsmouth for the maintenance of the UK carrier fleet and publish the results. 

The Government currently plans to spend £1 billion pounds to build a brand new dock in Portsmouth of similar size to the one that already exists in Belfast.

attributes.action: Require public transport providers to offer free transport to those in education
attributes.background: Most people who are still in education don't have a well paying job, or don't even have one. This means that travelling around is hard and can be very costly.
attributes.additional_details: We are taking part in a citizenship project and this is our topic/ issue. Not only will this make transport easier for people who are still trying to learn, but also means that the roads are clearer of young drivers. This therefore results in pollution levels from transport decreasing

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to send horses to slaughter.
attributes.background: I have volunteered at local riding schools for a number of years. Horses can be there as a companion for people who feel lonely. They can even be used to help restore confidence for disabled. Horses have been a vital part of our community’s and don’t deserve slaughter.
attributes.additional_details: Through this I have seen how therapeutic horses can be to people. Horses can help reduce stress levels and anxiety. The Riding for disabled (RDA) have used horses to help the disabled find something they can be good at so they don’t feel isolated. Horses were there for soldiers through the war and charged into battle bravely to save their rider and how do we repay them? We send them to slaughter. Thousands of horses are killed each year in UK slaughterhouses.
